DOC.brief_summary: This randomize controlled trial test efficacy mental health peer-led educational intervention call BRIDGES ( Building Recovery Individual Dreams Goals Education Support ) . The BRIDGES program 10-week , manualized education course design provide basic information etiology treatment mental illness , self-help skill , recovery principle order empower participant return value social role within community . BRIDGES peer-led program instructor adults mental illness . Hypothesis # 1 : Compared wait-list control , intervention participant report increase feeling psychological empowerment . Hypothesis # 2 : Compared wait-list control , intervention participant report increase feeling hopefulness . Hypothesis # 3 : Compared wait-list control , intervention participant report enhance cop ability . Hypothesis # 4 : Compared wait-list control , intervention participant report enhance recovery . Hypothesis # 5 : Compared wait-list control , intervention participant report great ability advocate health care provider . Hypothesis # 6 : Compared wait-list control , BRIDGES education course report increase knowledge cause treatment mental illness recovery principle .

DOC.detailed_description: Eligibility criterion include diagnosis serious mental illness experience severe functional impairment one life role . All study participant complete telephone interview three point time : study entry ( pre-intervention ) ; 8-weeks later ( immediate post-intervention ) ; 6-months intervention ( approximately 8 month study entry ) . Blinded interviewer administer valid reliable outcome assessment measure change subject ' knowledge mental illness ; emotional well-being ; empowerment ; hopefulness ; self-advocacy ; recovery . All study participant compensate time interview . All BRIDGES instructor people recovery serious mental illness certify experienced BRIDGES teacher . Fidelity BRIDGES curriculum assess ongoing basis throughout study .
